summary: The Locally Led Restoration Act of 2025 amends the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003 regarding third-party contracts for wildfire hazard fuel removal. It introduces new requirements for these contracts, including a salvage requirement (at least 10% salvage of vegetation removed), and outlines procedures for proposal notifications, responses, and environmental reviews. The bill also amends the National Forest Management Act of 1976, adjusting the threshold for advertised timber sales to reflect inflation and mandates annual adjustments based on the Consumer Price Index.
